reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very nice. Our trip was marred by a very noisy group of under 10s whose parents let them shout and run around the hotel with no consideration for others. Sound insulation is poor. Also the lavatory in the room is not enclosed which gives the atmosphere of staying/ sleeping in the lavatory. No bath only a very small shower. Curtains were thin and did not keep out the light. All in all disappointing and poor value.
reviews.title: beware of the 'open bath'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for a weekend in the riverhouse and we found the place through several brochures.
reviews.title: Good stay for a short weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a charming little hotel, but very small. Being 1.80m, my head was sticking to the ceiling in the room, which is maybe 1.90 high.
reviews.title: Perfect, just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners of the hotel are around, but they are very busy with cleaning and administration and don't spend much time with the guests.
reviews.title: ORIGINAL, LOVELY, TOTALLY WORTH IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's nice place, but too expensive to my taste. Because it's not a 4 start hotel, but you pay 4 star room prices.
reviews.title: A stylish, friendly, unusual alpine hotel with superb cuisine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riverhouse for two nights and chose it due to its good website and because we weren't attracted by the other somewhat oldfashioned Andermatt hotels. The last available room was no. 5 (Fels) and as it seems to be bigger than the others it was also quite expensive (just above SF 300!). We liked the size and warm interior design of the room, but there isn't any furniture to put away your things -no problem for just two nights in summer, but what do you do while on a skiing holiday?!. The bathroom, with a huge and nicely done bathtub in the corner, is beautiful, but not practical. I personally would have preferred a door to the bedroom... When I opened the bathroom window I looked immediately into the eyes of the waitress and the customers on the bar terrace, which is just next to this room on the same level. Nights were relatively quiet, you can hear the river on the backside of the house and the few cars on the cobblestone road on the front side; plus the other hotel guests above you.
reviews.title: Modern hotel with old charm, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel being so small it also lacks a kind of lobby or common room where you can sit down and maybe check out some hiking/biking maps or meet one of the other guests. The check-in area is the host's office and you're not welcomed to hang out there, of course.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant/breakfast room is very nice and cosy and I can imagine us sitting there in winter time eating fondue after a day out in the snow. On a sunny and hot July day it was too dark and cramped for my taste, but it's nothing to complain about - we didn't spend the day in there! Breakfast itself was perfect: fresh and simple and tasty. We also ate a delicious dinner on our first evening and drank an excellent bottle of wine at the hotel restaurant, reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Little hotel with very stylish concept and interior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To summarize: the Riverhouse hotel is a modern, innovative and charming hotel in a very old and small building with friendly hosts and staff. On the negative side: you pay too much for what you get.
reviews.title: this is the hotel in Andermatt to be

likes.liked: — the combi of the old with the new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in April 2009. The hotel itself is centrally located with the train station and cable car being 5/10 mins walk. Our room was located on the top floor (no lift) and even for just 3 nights it was a small room. While trying to make the room look aesthetically pleasing the piles of sticks just take up too much space in the room. Lighting in the room is also poor in the evening. The hotel website mentioned the 'open' bathroom, and it really is open with the toilet forming part of the room without walls/doors.
reviews.title: A jewel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the River House to celebrate our wedding anniversary and were very pleased with our choice. It is probably one of the newest, charming and most modern accommodations in Andermatt. We loved looking over and hearing the river from our bedroom! Our room was small but nicely and stylishly decorated, with nice details and finishing touches. Service was warm, friendly and professional. Breakfast was terrific with a nice variety of fresh fruits, sweet and savory choices including eggs cooked to order. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely return to the River House when we go back to Andermatt.
reviews.title: Romantic boutique hotel in Andermatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: perfect hotel. We were lucky to experience live music in their little apotheker bar which was great!The service nice, the hotel beautiful and good value!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in February 2011. A charming place with plenty of character (the lack of a door between the bedroom and the loo was more a quirk than character adding, mind). We stayed in the 'ski room' which, I think, is one of their smaller rooms. It was well appointed and comfortable. Old stone walls and homely decorations gave it such a welcoming vibe. A quick peek into larger room (after the residents had checked out) showed it also to be beautifully decorated.
reviews.title: Great find. Unique in Andermatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent and the breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Charming accommodation, centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We went back to Andermatt this year and stayed elsewhere (a cost thing) but went for an evening meal at the River House. It was excellent and I'd recommend a visit for the food even if you don't stay here.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We, unfortunately, did not stay at the River House. We made an unfortunate choice to stay at another hotel in the town (see my reviews to see which). This hotel, although is rated on TA as one of the top, is nowhere near the caliber of of this beautiful Inn.
reviews.title: A boutique hotel with warmth and character in a quiet ski town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did, however, check out the Inn and found a lovingly restored historic building renovated with care into wonderful, unique, stylish and modern rooms with character. We immediately regretted our choice and wish we could have moved from our hotel to here. We recommend anyone in the planning stage choose this instead.
reviews.title: Restaurant! (Still) one of the tastiest in the Alps

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one of the best dinners of our trip to Germany, Austria and Switzerland one night in the River House restaurant and came back multiple times for apres-ski drinks and snacks. The food, wine/beer, etc offerings and atmosphere is inviting. The couple who built and run the Inn are warm and friendly and appear to know the meaning of good hospitality.
reviews.title: I've been looking for this little pearl

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We believe The River House is currently the best offering in town!
reviews.title: More a private chalet than a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Brilliant combination of modern and traditional Swiss food in an excellent environment. Ate here two years ago and thought then this was the best in the Alps. Returned again just after Xmas, and the reviews remains. Also a nicely composed wine menu. Watch out for the cost of sparkling water!
reviews.title: Charming location
